Problem:
Consider a complex function \\( f(z) = e^{Az} \\) where A is a complex constant matrix, and z a complex variable. We explore how the function transforms under the action of a complex integral transformation defined by \\( g(f) = \\int_{C} e^{Bw}f(w) dw \\), where B is another complex constant matrix and C is a closed contour in the complex plane.

If the integral transformation \\( g(f) \\) is applied at some point between \\( z_0 \\) and \\( z_1 \\), will the resulting function at \\( z_1 \\) be dependent only on the effects of matrix A and not on B?
Explanation: The application of the integral transformation \\( g(f) = \\int_{C} e^{Bw}f(w) dw \\) introduces a new dynamic into the system, influenced by matrix B. Thus, even at point \\( z_1 \\), the function reflects combined influences of both A and B.
